BC-FEATURE-BUDGET-BOS 
  
 For Immediate Release  
 

   The Boston Globe plans to move the following FEATURE stories for
use by NYTimes News Service clients.

        For questions about stories, contact    Roy Greene    at the
Boston Globe,    617-929-3095.    For individual purchase of graphics
or photos please call 212 556-4204 or -1927.

   All stories will bear the BOS designator.

     NATIONAL (a)  

   AIRLINES-DEFIBRILATE (Undated) -- A passenger survives a heart
attack on a jetliner because the airline had defibrillators on
every flight. But not every airline has defibrillators on board. By
Anne E. Kornblut. 1100 words.

     COMMENTARY (k)  

   NYHAN-COLUMN (Undated) -- Let's invite our leaders to take the
MCAS tests. By David Nyhan.

   JACKSON-COLUMN (Undated) _ Black power advocate Kwame Ture was
ahead of his time. By Derrick Jackson.

     ENTERTAINMENT/ARTS (e)  

   MUSIC-OFFSPRING (Undated) _ Trash and hardship come together in
a punk ``Americana.'' By Jim Sullivan.

   MUSIC-ROCK (Undated) _ Phish has always operated with a lot of
freedom _ and that freedom just got even wider with a recent
contract extension from Elektra Records. By Steve Morse.

   STAGE-TOWN (New York) -- Among the plays and musicals recently
opened on Broadway, the best bang for the buck is George C. Wolfe's
revival of ``On the Town.'' By Ed Siegel.

   AUTHOR-KAYE (Lexington, Mass.) _ Myrna Kaye's latest book on the
social history of American furniture pays tribute to one Charles
Hess of Cincinnati, who had the very American idea of improving on
the commonplace. By Margo Miller. 1800 words.

   BOOK-MOVIES (Undated) _ A European's view on how money makes the
movies. By Michael Blowen.

   BOOK-NATION (Undated) _ In an extensive study of Plymouth Rock
in the national memory, author John Seelye finds ``in the American
heart an enduring affection for the events of 1620,'' however those
events have been interpreted. By Michael Kenney.

     SPORTS       (s)  

   FBN-PATRIOTS-BLEDSOE (Foxborough, Mass.) -- After Drew Bledsoe
threw eight passes with an index finger broken in two places, he's
held in a different light. By Michael Madden. 900 words.

   FBC-COLLEGE-NOTEBOOK (Undated) _ Check out the ESPN-USA Today
coaches poll and then take a look on Sunday. Don't be surprised if
you find a change at the top. By Mark Blaudschun.

   OUTDOORS-COLUMN (Undated) _ The sound of shotguns booming is a
convival reminder of harvest season, and a nice sound to wake to.
By Tony Chamberlain.

     SKIING (s)  

   SKI-BANNED-BOARDS (Undated) _ Four ski areas in New England do
not want the money, business, or fun-loving approach to the sport
offered by snowboarders. By Tony Chamberlain.

   SKI-COLUMN (Undated) _ The question came in an e-mail from a
reader of last week's Ski Section. How could we possibly raise a
question of whether skiers should wear helmets? By Tony
Chamberlain.

     The Boston Globe
